headline: Quick Quiche
description: This quick quiche is a crustless version of the classic baked custard made with Swiss cheese, milk, and eggs for a no-fuss, stress-free breakfast.

video.description: This dense, flavorful quiche doesn't need a crust to be a brunch star.
video.name: Quick Quiche

name: Quick Quiche

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Lightly grease a 9-inch pie pan.
Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels. Crumble and set aside.

Cover the bottom of the prepared pie pan with shredded cheese and crumbled bacon. Whisk together milk, eggs, flour, onion, butter, and salt in a large bowl until smooth. Pour mixture over cheese and bacon in the pie pan.
Bake quiche in the preheated oven until the center is set, about 35 minutes. Serve hot or cold.

review.reviewBody: Delicious!
Easy to make and tasted great
I used leftover chicken instead of bacon for WW friendly breakfast. Added spinach and did not use a crust. I only had to count the points for the cheese and low fat butter. Yummy
This didnt work out for me. Adding flour just made it too compact. I would eliminate it next time.

Delicious. Needed a way to make eggs for a dietary need but who doesn’t like them. Texture was great, taste was wonderful. Added spinach for yet more iron! I also adopted this to crustless. By lining bottom of pie plate with Mozzerella and using GF flour(1/4 cup), it is a delicious option for me and my wife.
Try adding a splash of Worcestershire sauce, a trick I learned with scrambled eggs. It adds a really nice flavor.

Delicious! I have never made a quiche before, but this was a success. I know the recipe didn't call for a crust, but I had one in the fridge so I went ahead and used it. I swapped Colby Jack cheese for the Swiss because that is what I had on hand, and I sauteed the onions in the 2 Tablespoons of butter before adding - the flavor this added was AMAZING! I think next time, however, I will drain the butter before adding in the sauteed onions, there was a pool of grease at the top of the quiche when it was done baking. Lastly, I took another reviewer's advice and only added in 1 1/4 cups milk - I will be keeping this measurement as the texture of the quiche was PERFECT. I love how customizable this recipe is, I will definitely be making this again!
ok

Taught my 13 year old to make this, he loves it. We made it in a muffin pan so we could customize it. His was sausage and Colby jack cheese. Mine was white cheddar cheese, red peppers and spinach. He makes it once a week now!
Delicious!! I made this as written except used complete pancake mix instead of flour. This will be a regular for me!

So easy, so good! Even though I know cheddar bakes "greasy", it was the only cheese in the fridge so I made do. Hoping next time to have Swiss on hand so as to experience this wonder fully! If cheddar is all you have on hand, it's best omit the butter. Would love to try this cold, but I fear that it will be all gone by tomorrow! Edit 2018: Tried this with a tsp of curry in the mix - still delicious but in a whole new way!

I kind of did my own thing here, trying my to cut carbs, and using ingredients I had that I needed to get rid of (1).
First, I used ham instead of bacon (my preference anyway, but it’s what I had).
I used 1 cup of heavy whipping cream (so not to go to waste), and 1/4 cup milk.
And I used almond flour instead of regular flour. 
It turned out delicious, but not as fluffy as it would have been having used regular flour.
But still Great!

Oh and I added just a little bit of mixed cheddar cheese to the top (because I had some), and I mixed my Swiss cheese and ham into the egg mixture. Simply poured it into my pan and cooked it that way.
As other have said, use less milk and use Bisquick for a nicer rise. I cup milk works well.
Really good, and quick!! I added some fresh parsley and green onion for color. Thanks for sharing, will definitely make this again!
Tasty. Used cheddar cheese. Swiss would add some depth. Used Bisquick mix. Mix with milk first, then butter, or it gets clumpy. Loved not needing a piecrust. Didn't add any salt.
Very easy & versatile! Cut back on salt as bacon is salty. I added parsley, pepper & Italian seasoning. Will make again!
This recipe is so easy and very good. Going to fix this for my family on Easter.

As is, it’s far too salty. The first time around, that was the overwhelming taste. There’s already bacon & butter, why add a whole teaspoon of salt? Made a second time with half the salt and was much better.

Everyone was right!! This was amazing!!! I wanted more, so as someone else suggested I increased the ingredients by half, except the milk, where I added two cups. I also added, broccoli, cauliflower and mushrooms. Thanks for a great recipe!

I was looking for something different for dinner. This was it! The best quiche ever. Very simple and quick to prepare. I cheated by using precooked bacon bits to save on time. This quiche is now on the monthly menu!

INCREDIBLE. Best thing I’ve ever eaten. It was easy and delicious. I (a small person) ate the whole thing in two meals, so this isn’t exactly a huge family dish, but it’s absolutely amazing. Any cheese will work I think.

Very tasty. I used a full pound of bacon and reserved 2 T of bacon fat (in lieu of butter) that I used to sauté my onions in along with a package of fresh spinach. I cooked until all moisture was gone from the spinach. I sprayed my pie dish w/PAM and crumbled the bacon in the bottom, then topped w/the onion and spinach mixture. I topped that with generous handfuls of shredded cheddar, then poured the custard mixture over all. I used half and half in place of regular milk and baked for 40 minutes. It was absolutely delicious and as you can ready from other reviews, very adaptable. Thank you!

I tried a vegetarian version, without the bacon. Used Gouda cheese, and added fresh spinach, sautéed sliced baby bella mushrooms, and chopped sun-dried tomatoes in Italian seasoned oil ... absolutely delicious!
I made this recipe with prosciutto instead of bacon and topped with chives. Super easy and delicious.

Simply delicious!! And easy!
I had to adjust some ingredients using the cheese that I had at home, and it worked so well!!! I just loved it - and my not-a-big-quiche-fan husband too!!!!

This was very easy, but took more time than 35 min, probably more like 50 min. I used cheddar cheese because I prefer it over swiss. I seasoned with some garlic powder and Lawry's. I followed another reviewers suggestion,, and put in some of the bacon grease for added flavor. Yum. I've made this recipe before but it was with Bisquick instead of flour, and I think I prefer the the Bisquick. After it came out of the oven and sat 5 min it settled and became quite flat. That's ok it was just as good. Next time I'll add some mushrooms. This is a keeper.
Easy and delightful for a change of pace
Excellent recipe! Easy to make with lots of flavor.
This is, by far, the BEST crustless quiche I have ever made. So easy and delicious +
Really easy- and super delicious! I did add a little bit of veg (sautéed mushrooms and broccoli) Will definitely cook this again!

I also loved this easy recipe, as did my husband and teen son! Followed directions pretty much exactly, but added some chopped spinach that was about to wilt and a dash of pepper. So easy and delicious!!
Too soft for my husbands liking. That might just be the melted cheese though.
This was so easy to make. I should have let it set longer though. Once it really firmed up, it was even better.

Delicious and easy! I had to make a few mods... almond milk instead of milk, green onions instead of onions and jalapeños cheese instead of Swiss...only because I didn’t have those items and it still was excellent!!! Husband loved it!!
Sooo Good! I used the blender and pancake mix instead of flour. It was so fluffy like soufflé.

OMG!! This recipe is FANTASTIC!!! I've always been afraid to attempt making another quiche after I ruined one many, many years ago. I was inspired by the video and the reviews, which both emphasized ease and success, and boy were they right! I added asparagus pieces, used cheddar, and baked it for 45 mins. (not sure if the ceramic quiche plate I used takes longer, or if making it in my toaster oven required the extra time; I may raise the temp next time to see if I can get it right in the 35 mins. instructed). I couldn't imagine a quiche w/out a crust, but after making this one I don't see any need for a crust. During the baking process, it almost seems as if some of the flour in the mix sinks down to the bottom of the plate and ends up turning into a sort of soft crust on its own. The end result is perfect, easy, and the taste is AMAZING! I will make this recipe for the rest of my life! Thank you a million times over!

I have a 5-year-old who hates eggs, so I'm always looking for ways to sneak them into her diet. We all loved this recipe! It was incredibly fluffy and light, and we didn't miss the crust. I added a little Coleman's mustard powder and cherry tomatoes, and it was perfect.
We used turkey sausage instead of bacon and added mushrooms. It was so delicious! We will definitely make this again!

I liked it very much. I added sausage, & broccoli to your recipe. It worked fine except I got carried away on the amounts of them and so it kinda crumbled when I went to serve it so I'll obey better next time. I used foil to line my pie pan & it helped clean up but it wasn't to easy to dish out the quiche. 
 I'll try something else next time to line the dish. thank you
This is awesome! I used Sauteed veggies, but the basic egg mixture is really good and easy! It’s a great recipe to use for any type of quiche. It’s a keeper!

Great recipe as is, but also lends itself to embellishment to personal tastes well. Depending on what’s on hand, i’ve added fresh mushrooms, baby spinach (cooked and cut up), green pepper, a smidgen of chili powder (it livens up scrambled eggs too, but just a pinch in both cases) and sometimes cut back swiss cheese a bit and replace it with old cheddar.Still it’s great as published here too. So i give it 5 stars
This was great. I loved the time saving quality and taste. I did add diced cherry tomatoes and they were a good addition to this recipe.
My family loved it! I like reading comments to help prepare. With mine, I sautéed the onion with minced garlic in the butter and used sausage instead of bacon.

I adapted the recipe by leaving out the bacon and adding veggies. I took advice from previous reviews add subbed the flour for pancake mix. I baked mine in cupcake pan and served them. It turned out great. If you want to serve yours as quiche muffins like I did recommend using silicone liners, cupcake liners or make sure you REALLY grease your pan or you will have a hard time getting them out.

This recipe is not a keeper for me. Even though there is no crust, it wasn’t that much faster. It’s missing vegetables (even though I added in parsley). It’s very heavy on the bacon, and even though I drained the bacon well, it still seemed greasy to me.
Did I round deeper individual dishes instead of pie plate, used one cup of milk and sautéed onions and broccoli first. Took long to cook.

I followed the recipe, adding a little bit of ham and spinach, but for some reason it took 70 minutes to cook through instead of only 35. It was still liquid at 35 mins. In the end though it tasted very good.

This is a great go-to recipe when you need to make brunch or breakfast ahead of time. I made this recipe - as written - for Christmas brunch, since we are pressed for time due to travel obligations. I threw in one bag (12 oz.) of frozen chopped broccoli (after fully microwaving it). I did not saute the onion, although I was tempted to (doing so is not needed). I also did not layer the recipe, but mixed it altogether. I made it the night before, put it in the fridge and microwaved it the next morning. Easy and tasty. Recommended!

My family and I love this recipe. I only make a few changes, and really it is the addition of a few items. I add chopped maple honey ham (from the deli) and chopped broccoli to the mixture. Just adds a bit more flavor. Thanks for posting and sharing as we will use 5his
Used 1/4 cup less milk and put it under the broiler for crisping. Added broccoli and bacon, next time I will try mushrooms. Very good recipe!
this was so easy to make, i used mozerella as a base for the cheese, i added mushrooms, and spinach ! how wonderful!!!

Great taste! Added minced garlic and sautéed with onion in bacon grease. Used cheddar because that’s what I had on hand. Topped with shredded Parmesan. Probably won’t add salt next time, but will make again!
This is fantastic every time I make it!

I love this recipe! This has become staple in my recipe collection. The first time I made it, I follwed the directions exactly and WOW! The base recipe can also be tweaked to suit your fancy. I ALWAYS USE 1% MILK and usually omit the butter (the cheese has enough oil on it's own although they do say "Everything's better with butter"! That said - I've made an all veggie version with bite sized pieces of steamed or a package of frozen chopped spinach that I've defrosted and squeezed by, then added it to a bit of diced sauteed onion, and sliced mushrooms, I've added dijon mustard or dried mustard, I've substituted diced ham for the bacon, I've switched up cheeses and have used cheddar (the pre-shredded stuff is fine), swiss or gruyere.. My only other tweak is that I add a heaping teaspoon of baking powder to the flour to add some additional lightness to the quiche. Last but not least, the quich fits perfectly into a square Pyrex baking dis.

I liked the simple recipe, but made couple of changes. Instead of bacon, I used canned chicken and shrimp. I also used some veggies - tomato and some peppers. Here is what I did and it came out really good - kids loved it.

Cook the chicken and shrimp (I cut the shrimp in bit size pieces) with half the onion and half of one jalapeno) with bit of crushed peppers and a pinch of allspice as we like our food spicy. You can adjust the spice to your need. 

Happy eating!
Quick n easy, added what I wanted, didn’t have Swiss so used a texmex blend.
This is my new go to quiche recipe. No need for a crust and I like the crust! It is so easy to make it your own with different cheese and meat if you want to. It’s a definite keeper.

I have made this several times. The first time I followed the directions. Other times I swap out the Swiss for whatever I have on hand.. mozzarella, cheddar, etc. and swap out the bacon or add to it (turkey sausage, mushrooms, spinach, green peppers, etc.). It’s always a little different, but the base is the same. I highly recommend it for a quick and easy meal!

I used a glass pie dish, ham instead of bacon and Monterey Jack instead of Swiss. I had to add about 10-15 minutes of cook time to give the top a little bit of browning and to make sure the eggs were fully cooked in the center. I serve warm right or if there oven instead of traditional quiche that is cooled. My young kids (4 and 6) really love this recipe.
thank you sarah jo for the 6 muffin idea, super I live alone & this will take care of me for 6 day's! I love all the reviews & all recipes.
I added Italian herbs, peppercorn, Parmesan instead of Swiss cheese and absolutely loved it. My favorite quiche yet. I liked the cheesy bacon crust vs the bread crust.
More cheese - 6oz shredded cheddar

This is a fantastic recipe that is so easily modifiable based on what you have on hand. I took one reviewers tip and used 1 cup of milk and 1/2 cup of plain Greek yogurt (mixing it together before adding the other ingredients. I also used Monterey Jack because it's what I had. I sautéed the sweet onion until caramelized and then threw in a diced red bell pepper. I also used Whole Wheat flour instead of AP for added nutrition, and folded in grape tomatoes sliced in half and a diced small avocado. So basically, this is a great base of ingredients that allows you to use up anything fresh you have on hand to make a great meal! I served mine with hot sauce, my husband had it with toast.

This was so easy to make. Very light and tasty. I made some changes based on what I had in the fridge. I went with a combo of Swiss,Provolone and garlic herb Jack cheese. Then I added left over baked ham and broccoli lightly fried with garlic (also left over from a previous dish). I used half milk and half heavy whipping cream ( left over from a previous dish) I went with pancake batter instead of flour and add shredded Cheddar cheese on top after the egg mixture. Will be making this often-I love using leftovers to make a new meal
Didn't have swiss cheese. Used four cheese blend instead. Definitely will make it again.

This was great! I only had cheddar (probably would've been better with swiss). One significantly change: I did not add salt; one comment mentioned the flavor was too salty, and I realized the cheese and butter already had salt. I did not add the bacon, as I avoid swine. The flavor was not bland at all! And it took 40 minutes to completely set in the oven.
Basic, good, fast.

The family loved it! I was afraid it would be too bland or them without some herbs or spices, but the blend of bacon and swiss cheese added a good amount of flavor. There was nothing left at the end of the meal!

You can make this recipe according to the directions or you can change it to whatever you have available. Instead of bacon, leftover chicken or a tin of tuna, ham, beef or anything else you have available can be used. This is really a versatile recipe and it takes just a few minutes to assemble. I also like to add fried mushrooms or green bell peppers, actually any cooked vegetables like peas, green beans potatoes. Cheddar cheese with sliced tomatoes on top is also a nice addition.

So good and easy. I only had 5 pieces of bacon, so I used that. I had about 5 ounces of Swiss and so that made up for the bacon. I chopped up onion, green pepper, and mushrooms and sauteed it before adding it to the egg mixture. It took an additional 5-10 minutes to bake.
It was easy and quick to make, and tasted great. I added dried thyme, and avocado. I ended up using Havarti cheese instead of Swiss cheese. I’ll be making this again in the future.
This is a wonderful base recipe! I made it today for lunch with a friend. I added some red pepper and fresh spinach. I left out the nutmeg and added garlic powder. It came out great!
Easy and good!
SO DELICIOUS! I substituted thawed frozen spinach instead of bacon and added an additional layer of crumbled Parmesan cheese on the bottom. It took 50min to cook, but FANTASTIC RECIPE
Excellent! We used a deep-dish frozen pie crust and added a 1/2 cup of shredded spinach. Delicious!

Worked great.

Mods: Added mix of sausage, bell peppers and onions in place of the bacon (didn't have). Sure original would be as delicious.

My family loves this with the changes I made. I added 1 tsp. Italian seasoning, 1 tsp. yellow mustard, 1/4 c. ground pepper, and about 3/4 c. chopped broccoli or asparagus. Also, when I have time, I saute the onions in the butter. Sometimes I add celery to the onions. Instead of the bacon, I add chopped ham and/or Canadian bacon. I sprinkle the top with grated Parmesan cheese and a little chili powder, too. Experiment with foods and seasonings you like and enjoy!

Absolutely amazing quiche it was fluffy and delicious. I love making this quiche, it's super easy. 1 teaspoon of salt came out way too salty. Second time I made it I put much less salt and it was perfect.
I liked it,but my husband thought it bland.
This is excellent! I might try some red or green pepper in it, mainly for color; and some spice.
I sure did. I had ham, onion and bell peppers. It was very good
Tasty recipe! I added some chopped spinach to the recipe to get some green in there. Very easy to make. Will make again!!
very easy to make.....did mine with Ham, Cheddar, Onions, and Green Peppers......delish

Very easy to prepare. I reduced crumbled bacon strips to 6 & the result still carried a full bacon flavor. The cheese melted on the bottom to create a firm bottom "crust". I also used a scallion which gave the quiche a nice edge/finish to the bacon.

The 35 minute bake provided a near perfect consistency after allowing the Pyrex pie pan to sit/set for 5 to 7 minutes.

This recipe is a keeper.
Great recipe, easily adaptable.

Suuuuuper yummy! My family and I loved this recipe. To be honest I didn’t expect much. But holy cow it was so yummy. I substituted sharp shredded cheddar and it was amazing. I also only used egg whites. I used six egg whites to be exact. And it turned out perfect! I found this on a whim so it wasn’t planned at all. Next time I’ll have Swiss ready.

Amazing recipe. Like said in the video you can add anything you want in there and it will be amazing. I substituted shredded cheddar to American cheese just because I got some at the deli. I simulated shredded cheese by cutting American deli into little pieces. Came out beautiful
Loved it did add a medium grated potato and squeezed off liquid and mixed all together and divided into two dishes and baked for 40mins. Was amazing. Thanks for the recipe. ????
Delicious, quick and easy. I did add broccoli. I sautéed the onions and broccoli for just a minute or two in the butter before I mixed it all together. Perfection!
It was good. The whole family loved it. I used a combination of onions and peppers to add a little flavor. Next time I make it, it could use a bit of pepper.

Before calling people names you may want to be better informed. Making this has nothing to do with being lazy. Some people are on Paleo diets and I am diabetic so no pastry means no carbs which means no blood sugar spikes for me. I love quiche and this is just as much a quiche as one with pie crust. This is a delicious recipe.

This is a great jumping off point for a crustless quiche. I used the exact egg mixture as written but added asparagus, white onion, red bell pepper, green onion and chopped honey ham. Sautéed the veggies first until soft then spooned the veggies into a muffin pan for twelve individual servings. Poured in the egg mixture and baked for 35 Mom.

EXCELLENT! I made this quiche on a whim for dinner and my husband is a happy man, as am I. I followed recipe as written but just chopped up the swiss cheese instead of shredding and added a handful of mild cheddar and broccoli to the egg mixture. It was just great.
I added chopped spinach and feta cheese. Beacause of the additions, I didn’t add the flour or butter.
The only change I made was left out the salt since we have high BP. You can add whatever your taste buds desire. The no crust is a hit with me. This turned out wonderful. Thanks for the recipe!!

I added some left over Asparagus, small tomatoes quartered and Zucchini.
It was delicious and light without the crust.
Wonderfully easy. I thawed and added some California Blend veggies and it took longer to set. Next time I think I will up the heat to 400F as I had to add 20 minutes at 350.

This is a great recipe that can be adjusted and added to, to suit your taste or what you have on hand. I did not have swiss cheese, used sharp cheese, added some chopped ham, leftover asparagus, red pepper flakes.

I liked this but kept wishing for that flakey, buttery crust. I did add just a little mustard powder, with just a touch of red pepper flakes and dill to the egg mixture. It had a very good flavor. I topped the quiche with additional shredded sharp cheese and a shake of good parma cheese. In my oven I had to cook the quiche a total of 60 min. I just checked it till a knife came out clean in the center. I'm curious how a complete pancake mix would work as suggested by another reviewer. Since I'm watching by daily carb total this was a good choice.
